com.yantra.api.wms.picking

Interface prepareForDeposit

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.WMSApi, YIFApi

    public interface prepareForDeposit

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document prepareForDeposit(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      prepareForDeposit API processes tasks belonging to activity group id OUTBOUND_PICKING as following:
      It takes all the tasks in progress for the given user and completes the pick tasks to appropriate location (equipment location if equipment is used, else to blank target location).

    • Method Detail

      • prepareForDeposit

        org.w3c.dom.Document prepareForDeposit(YFSEnvironment env,
                                       org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                       java.rmi.RemoteException

        prepareForDeposit API processes tasks belonging to activity group id OUTBOUND_PICKING as following:

          It takes all the tasks in progress for the given user and completes the pick tasks to appropriate location (equipment location if equipment is used, else to blank target location). The target LPN field need not be updated as it will be already set if the pick is to a container.

          Further move tasks are created for the picked task. The task type of the new task is based on the Next Step Task Type for the current tasks task type. If an LPN is used for picking, the move task is created for the LPN, else the move is created for the loose inventory. If a source case is picked (i.e. Source LPN is populated and ItemId is void. If itemId is not void, then the item is picked out of the source LPN.) into equipment or into hand, then move is created for this source LPN.

          The target location for the move task is determined as follows:
          • If target location is given for the original pick task, then that location is used.
          • If the pick is into an outbound container and all tasks for that container are picked,then the target location is the location associated with the activity code corresponding to the next transaction to ADD_TO_CONTAINER transaction for the container in the container pipeline. If no transaction exists after ADD_TO_CONTAINER transaction then location assigned to shipment/carrier will be the target location for the move task. If there exists some more pending tasks, the target location is the Out Staging Location of the last location from which pick was effected.
          • If loose inventory was picked or the pick was into an inventory container, the target location is the location associated with the activity code ADD_TO_CONTAINER.
          • if the location cannot be found in any of the above steps, it is defaulted to the last pick location's Out Staging Location. If this location deos not exist, the target location is left blank and can be overridden by user during deposit.


        For other activity groups it determines target location if target location is not present.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:
        com.yantra.wms.japi.ue.WMSBeforePrepareForDepositUE
        This user exit is called before determining the target location of the pick task. If the user exit returns a target location, then that location will be stamped as the target location of the pick task. No logic to determine the target location will be executed further.

        Events Raised: None

        Audits: None

        Pre Conditions: None

        Post Conditions: None

        Output Template Support: No

        Database Extensibility Support: No

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: No

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        No Output XML.

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
